title.narrative: Bio rights and behavior change in WASH

description.narrative: A finance mechanism for sustainable development and behavior change

Bio rights approach – behavioural change in WASH: Bio-rights is a microcredit finance mechanism that combines poverty reduction, environmental improvement and behavioral change. Bio-rights adds a market-based incentive to conservation and development action. Communities that normally have few if any financing opportunities receive micro-credits for environmentally-friendly economic development. Instead of paying interest, the communities improve their hygiene behavior and undertake environmental conservation actions, such as ecosystem rehabilitation measures that enhance the water buffer (3R approach and RWH techniques). With the support of the Dutch WASH Alliance local communities in Koulikoro and Mopti Region gained access to micro-credits for sustainable development in return for their active involvement in behavior change for improved hygiene and sanitation. This has been a great success and will be further up-scaled in 2015 - to more communities and incl. ecosystem rehabilition.
